member.name: T:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials
member.summary: Provides credentials for IronPdf's embedded Chrome browser to log-in to an intranet, extranet or website, impersonating a user. This allows a unique ability to render web-pages as PDFs even on secure intranets, extranets and websites.

member.name: M:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.Finalize
member.summary: Destructor cleans up all temporary cookies files for the HttpLoginCredentials instance.

member.name: F:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.CustomCookies
member.summary: A Dictionary which allows custom cookies to be posted with every login request, and HTTP request made by RenderUriToHml methods.

member.name: F:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.CustomHttpHeaders
member.summary: A dictionary of custom HTTP headers to be sent with every HTTP Request

member.name: F:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.CustomPostFiles
member.summary:
Optional, Advanced Usage: Specifies a collection files to summited on every PDF rendering request. Allows images and documents to be submitted to forms such that the output will be rendered as an PDF.
Note: The Key is the name of the post field, The value is the full file path.. UrlEncoding is not required.

member.name: F:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.CustomPostVariables
member.summary:
Optional: Specifies a collection of HTTP 'POST' variables to submit on every PDF rendering request.
Note: The 'key' is the name of the post field, The 'value' is its value. UrlEncoding is not required.

member.name: F:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.EnableCookies
member.summary: Enables cookies to be stored and sent when using RenderUriToHml methods.

member.name: F:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.LoginFormPostVariables
member.summary: Optional: Specifies a collection of HTTP form variables to post/submit to .

member.name: P:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.LoginFormUrl
member.summary: Optional: Gives the URL to post website login-form authentication. Should be the absolute Url which the form's action attribute specifies.

member.name: P:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.NetworkPassword
member.summary: Optional: Password credential for Windows / Linux network security authentication.

member.name: P:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.NetworkUsername
member.summary: Optional: User-name credential for Windows / Linux network security authentication.

member.name: P:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.Proxy
member.summary: Specifies an Http proxy server. Use the pattern: http(s)://user-name:password@host:port/

member.name: P:IronPdf.ChromeHttpLoginCredentials.UserAgent
member.summary: The Http User-Agent header which will be used to fetch any remote HTML.

member.name: T:IronPdf.ChromePdfRenderer
member.summary:
IronPdf.ChromePdfRenderer allows any web page or Html 'snippet' to be turned into a PDF document using an up-to-date embedded Chrome browser.
As of 2021 Iron Software recommend as our best PDF Renderer and a drop-in replacement for this class.

Login credentials which includes CustomCookies property

member.name: P:IronPdf.ChromePdfRenderOptions.ViewPortHeight
member.summary:
Defines a virtual screen height used to render HTML to PDF in IronPdf. Measured in pixels.
Viewport size is important in modern responsive HTML5 + CSS3 websites (e.g. Bootstrap framework websites) because the rendering and order of elements on the screen is dependent on viewport size.
The default viewport is 1280px wide by 1024px high to ensure the desktop version of a website is rendered unless otherwise specified. Smaller sizes (particularly width) will render responsive versions of many websites.

member.name: P:IronPdf.ChromePdfRenderOptions.ViewPortWidth
member.summary:
Defines a virtual screen width used to render HTML to PDF in IronPdf. Measured in pixels.
Viewport size is important in modern responsive HTML5 + CSS3 websites (e.g. Bootstrap framework websites) because the rendering and order of elements on the screen is dependent on viewport size.
The default viewport is 1280px wide by 1024px high to ensure the desktop version of a website is rendered unless otherwise specified. Smaller sizes (particularly width) will render responsive versions of many website

member.name: T:IronPdf.Editing.BarcodeEncoding
member.summary:
Barcode Encoding Types. Please check the supported characters for each encoding type as some do not support all symbols.
Setting a when rendering Barcodes chooses the type and design of barcode to be generated.

member.name: F:IronPdf.Editing.BarcodeEncoding.Code128
member.summary:
Code 128 (1D barcode format). Code 128 is a high-density linear barcode symbology defined in ISO/IEC 15417:2007.
Supported characters include: All alphabetic and numeric characters.

member.name: F:IronPdf.Editing.BarcodeEncoding.Code39
member.summary:
Code 39 (1D barcode format). Code 39 is a variable length, discrete barcode symbology. The Code 39 specification defines 43 characters.
Supported characters include: Digits from (0-9), Uppercase (A through Z), and these symbols: (-.$/+% space)

member.name: F:IronPdf.Editing.BarcodeEncoding.QRCode
member.summary:
QR Code (2D barcode format). QR code (abbreviated from Quick Response Code) is a machine-readable optical label that contains information about the item to which it is attached. A QR code uses four standardized encoding modes to efficiently store data.
Supported characters include: All numeric, alphanumeric, byte/binary, and Japanese kanji.

member.summary: Behaviors when fitting HTML content to a physical paper size Can affect zoom level and css layout

member.name: F:IronPdf.Engines.Chrome.FitToPaperModes.None
member.summary:
Do nothing.
Default Chrome PDF printing behavior. Uses to specify zoom level.
has no effect. Instead, Chrome will automatically set the view port based on . Use to specify CSS media style.
member.remarks: Useful when using 'print' CSS media style or printing documents to match the Chrome browser print preview.

member.name: F:IronPdf.Engines.Chrome.FitToPaperModes.FixedPixelWidth
member.summary:
Fit an exact number of pixels onto each PDF page.
Uses to specify the pixel width to fit on each PDF page.
has no effect. Instead, IronPdf will calculate the zoom level based on and
member.remarks: Useful when an optimal pixel width is known or printing documents to match a Chrome browser window display

member.name: F:IronPdf.Engines.Chrome.FitToPaperModes.Automatic
member.summary:
Measures minimum HTML content width after it is rendered by the browser and calculates based on the width of the content.
and have no effect and are calculated automatically by IronPdf.
member.remarks: Useful when fitting a wide content or content of unknown width onto a PDF page

member.name: F:IronPdf.Engines.Chrome.FitToPaperModes.AutomaticFit
member.summary:
Measures minimum HTML content width after it is rendered by the browser using the smallest view port possible, and calculates based on the width of the content.
Use to specify the minimum number of pixels to be fit on each PDF page.
has no effect and is calculated automatically by IronPdf.
member.remarks: Useful when fitting smaller content onto a wide page

member.name: T:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter
P:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.BaseUrl
member.summary:
The Base URL all URLS in the HtmlFragment will be relative to. This includes 'src' attributes on images, scripts, style-sheets and also hrefs on hyper-links.
Note: A base URL that points to a directory should end with a slash.
Base URL accepts file paths as well as URLS. If no BaseUrl is given, the HtmlHeaderFooter BaseUrl will be inherited from the main HTML document where possible.

member.name: P:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.MaxHeight
member.summary: Maximum Height of the Html Header / Footer in millimeters. This value must be set sufficiently high to display the full html header / footer content.

member.name: P:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.HtmlFragment
member.summary: The Html which will be use to render the Header / Footer. Should be an HTML snippet rather than a complete document. May contain styles & images. Merge meta-data into the HtmlFragment by putting any of these placeholder strings into the text: {page} {total-pages} {url} {date} {time} {html-title} {pdf-title}. An alternative mail-merge style using the pattern also workd HtmlFragment is a stand alone HTML document which does not inherit styles or settings from your main HTML content unless is set true

member.name: P:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.LoadStylesAndCSSFromMainHtmlDocument
member.summary:
Loads style code blocks and links to CSS style sheets from the main HTML document (which provides the PDF content) into the .
By default, Html Headers and Footers are stand- alone HTML documents with their own default styles. Setting to true will attempt to load all STYLE and LINK tags from the main HTML document (which renders teh PDF) into the .
If your main HTML document contains complex CSS frameworks, styles the HEAD or BODY element heavily or loads CSS from javascript then this method may not work as intended.
This feature is not available for RenderUrlAsPdf methods. It works for RenderHtmlAsPdf, HTMLToPdf and HtmlFileToPdf conversions only.
It is often preferable to load style sheets explicitly into your HTML Headers and Footers as STYLE and LINK tags within the for granular control

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.Clone
member.summary: Supports . Creates a deep copy of this class instance.
member.returns: A deep clone of this instance. Use explicit casting to convert object back to the intended type.

member.name: T:IronPdf.ImageToPdfConverter
member.summary:
The ImageToPdfConveter class can be used to create PDF documents from images. It accepts both image files and objects as input.
The ImageToPdf static methods create simple PDF documents containing each image as one page of the created PDF.
To rasterize PDF documents as images (the reverse operation), see and

member.name: M:IronPdf.ImageToPdfConverter.ImageToPdf(System.String,IronPdf.Imaging.ImageBehavior,IronPdf.ChromePdfRenderOptions)
member.summary: Converts a single image file to an identical PDF document of matching dimensions. The default PaperSize is A4. You can set it via ImageToPdfConverter.PaperSize. Note: Imaging.ImageBehavior.CropPage will set PaperSize equal to ImageSize.
member.param: File path of the image file.
Describes how image should be placed on the PDF page
Rendering options
member.returns: Returns a document which can then be edited, saved or served over the web.

Please Dispose() each Bitmap object after use.
member.param: The resolution of the output Bitmap in 'Dots Per Inch'. Higher DPI creates larger bitmap files of higher image quality.
member.returns: An array of System.Drawing.Bitmap image objects which can be saved, manipulated, displayed or edited programmatically.

Renders the pages of the PDF as PNG (Portable Network Graphic) files and saves them to disk.
Specific image dimensions and page numbers may be given as optional parameters
FileNamePattern should normally contain an asterisk (*) character which will be substituted for the page numbers
member.param: A full or partial file path for the output files containing an asterisk. E.g. C:\images\pdf_pages_*.png
A list of the specific zero based page numbe to render as images.
The desired resolution of the output Images.
member.returns: An array of the file paths of the image files created.
member.remarks: The will be ignored under Linux and macOS.

member.name: T:IronPdf.License
member.summary: Allows IronPdf license keys to be applied globally across an application.

member.name: P:IronPdf.License.IsLicensed
member.summary:
Determines whether this instance of IronPDF is Licensed.
Will return false unless a is set to a valid trial or full license key in IronPdf.License.LicenseKey, Web.Config , App.Config or appsettings.json in .Net Core.
See https://ironpdf.com/licensing/ and https://ironpdf.com/docs/license/license-keys/
member.returns: True if the license key given is valid.

member.name: P:IronPdf.License.LicenseKey
member.summary:
Removes watermarks. Get Licensed at https://ironpdf.com/licensing
For .Net framework applications, a license key can alternatively be added to Web.Config or App.Config XML file using <add key="IronPdf.LicenseKey" value="IRONPDF-LICENSE-KEY"/> within the appSettings tag. See https://ironpdf.com/docs/license/license-keys/
For .Net Core applications, a license key may be added to appsettings.json where the key name is "IronPdf.LicenseKey" and the value is a valid IronPDF trial or full license key.
See https://ironpdf.com/licensing/ for licensing options.

member.name: M:IronPdf.License.IsValidLicense(System.String)
member.summary:
Determines whether a string license key is valid.
See https://ironpdf.com/licensing/ for trial, development and commercial deployment licensing options.
member.param: IronPDF license key as a string
member.returns: True if the license key given is valid.

member.summary: The user may not edit the PDF unless they have the Owner password.

member.summary: The user may re-arrange pages, rotate pages and manage PDF thumbnails, but may not otherwise edit the PDF unless they have the Owner password.

member.summary: The user may edit the PDF as allowed by their PDF client software.

member.summary: The user may only print the PDF at low resolution unless they have the Owner password.

member.name: F:IronPdf.Security.PdfPrintSecurity.FullPrintRights
member.summary: Users may print the PDF without restriction.

member.name: T:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings
member.summary:
A class defining user security settings for a PDF document.
Allows the developer to control user access passwords, encryption, and also who may edit, print and copy content from the PDF document
Implemented in .

member.name: M:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.MakePdfDocumentReadOnly(System.String)
member.summary:
Makes this PDF document read only such that:
Content is encrypted at 128 bit. Copy and paste of content is disallowed. Annotations and form editing are disabled.
member.param: The owner password for the PDF. A string for owner password is required to enable PDF encryption and all document security options.

member.name: M:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.RemovePasswordsAndEncryption
member.summary:
Removes all user and owner password security for a PDF document. Also disables content encryption.
Content is encrypted at 128 bit. Copy and paste of content is disallowed. Annotations and form editing are disabled.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.AllowUserAnnotations
member.summary:
Gets or sets the permissions for users to annotate the PDF document with comments.
If AllowUserAnnotations is set false, the must be set for the security measure to take effect.
member.value: true if users may annotate the PDF document, otherwise false.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.AllowUserCopyPasteContent
member.summary:
Gets or sets the permissions for users to extract or 'copy & paste' content (text and images) from the PDF document.
If AllowUserCopyPasteContent is set false, the must also be set for the security measure to take effect.
member.value: true if users may 'copy and paste' content out of the PDF otherwise, false.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.AllowUserCopyPasteContentForAccessibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the permissions for users to extract or 'copy & paste' content (text and images) from the PDF document for accessibility.
member.value: true if users may 'copy and paste' content out of the PDF otherwise, false.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.AllowUserEdits
member.summary:
Gets or sets the permissions for users edit the PDF document. The features to edit the document depends entirely on the PDF client software used by the end user.
If editing rights are restricted, then the must be set for the security measure to take effect.
member.value: The value for user edit security.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.AllowUserFormData
member.summary:
Gets or sets the permissions for users to fill-in (enter data into) forms in the PDF document.
If AllowUserFormData is set false, the must be set for the security measure to take effect.
Note. If you want to make the form readonly in Adobe Acrobat Reader please call method or set to and set .
member.value: true if users may annotate the PDF document, otherwise false. Setting AllowUserFormData true will also enable annotations.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.AllowUserPrinting
member.summary:
Gets or sets the permissions for users to print the PDF document.
If print rights are restricted, then the must be set for the security measure to take effect.
member.value: The value for user printing.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.OwnerPassword
member.summary:
Sets the owner password and enables 128Bit encryption of PDF content. An owner password is one used to enable and disable all other security settings.
OwnerPassword must be set to a non empty string value for , , ,s and to be restricted.

member.name: P:IronPdf.Security.PdfSecuritySettings.UserPassword
member.summary:
Sets the user password and enables 128Bit encryption of PDF content .
A user password if a password that each user must enter to open or print the PDF document.

member.name: T:System.Drawing.Dimension
member.summary: The Dimension class encapsulates the width and height of a component (in int precision) in a single object.
member.remarks: The class is associated with certain properties of components. Several methods defined by the Component class and the LayoutManager interface return a Dimension object. Normally the values of width and height are non-negative ints. The constructors that allow you to create a dimension do not prevent you from setting a negative value for these properties. If the value of width or height is negative, the behavior of some methods defined by other objects is undefined.

member.name: F:System.util.zlib.Deflate.LitBufsize
member.summary: Size of match buffer for literals/lengths. There are 4 reasons for
limiting lit_bufsize to 64K:
- frequencies can be kept in 16 bit counters
- if compression is not successful for the first block, all input
data is still in the window so we can still emit a stored block even
when input comes from standard input. (This can also be done for
all blocks if lit_bufsize is not greater than 32K.)
- if compression is not successful for a file smaller than 64K, we can
even emit a stored file instead of a stored block (saving 5 bytes).
This is applicable only for zip (not gzip or zlib).
- creating new Huffman trees less frequently may not provide fast
adaptation to changes in the input data statistics. (Take for
example a binary file with poorly compressible code followed by
a highly compressible string table.) Smaller buffer sizes give
fast adaptation but have of course the overhead of transmitting
trees more frequently.
- I can't count above 4

member.name: F:System.util.zlib.Deflate.MatchLength
member.summary: Window position at the beginning of the current output block. Gets
negative when the window is moved backwards.

member.name: F:System.util.zlib.Deflate.MaxChainLength
member.summary: To speed up deflation, hash chains are never searched beyond this
length. A higher limit improves compression ratio but degrades the speed.

member.name: F:System.util.zlib.Deflate.MaxLazyMatch
member.summary: Attempt to find a better match only when the current match is strictly
smaller than this value. This mechanism is used only for compression
levels >= 4.

member.name: F:System.util.zlib.Deflate.NiceMatch
member.summary: Stop searching when current match exceeds this

member.name: F:System.util.zlib.Deflate.PrevLength
member.summary: Length of the best match at previous step. Matches not greater than this
are discarded. This is used in the lazy match evaluation.

member.name: M:System.util.zlib.Deflate._tr_align
member.summary: Send one empty static block to give enough lookahead for inflate.
This takes 10 bits, of which 7 may remain in the bit buffer.
The current inflate code requires 9 bits of lookahead. If the
last two codes for the previous block (real code plus EOB) were coded
on 5 bits or less, inflate may have only 5+3 bits of lookahead to decode
the last real code. In this case we send two empty static blocks instead
of one. (There are no problems if the previous block is stored or fixed.)
To simplify the code, we assume the worst case of last real code encoded
on one bit only.

member.name: M:System.util.zlib.Deflate.deflate_fast(System.Int32)
member.summary: Compress as much as possible from the input stream, return the current
block state.
This function does not perform lazy evaluation of matches and inserts
new strings in the dictionary only for unmatched strings or for short
matches. It is used only for the fast compression options.

member.name: M:System.util.zlib.Deflate.deflate_slow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Same as above, but achieves better compression. We use a lazy
evaluation for matches: a match is finally adopted only if there is
no better match at the next window position.

member.name: M:System.util.zlib.Deflate.deflate_stored(System.Int32)
member.summary: Copy without compression as much as possible from the input stream, return
the current block state.
This function does not insert new strings in the dictionary since
uncompressible data is probably not useful. This function is used
only for the level=0 compression option.
NOTE: this function should be optimized to avoid extra copying from
window to pending_buf.

member.name: M:System.util.zlib.Deflate.fill_window
member.summary: Fill the window when the lookahead becomes insufficient.
Updates strstart and lookahead.
At least one byte has been read, or avail_in == 0; reads are
performed for at least two bytes (required for the zip translate_eol
option -- not supported here).

implementation to provide an additional safety check. PPP uses Z_SYNC_FLUSH

decompressing, PPP checks that at the end of input packet, inflate is

member.name: M:System.util.zlib.Tree.build_tree(System.util.zlib.Deflate)
member.summary: Construct one Huffman tree and assigns the code bit strings and lengths.
Update the total bit length for the current block.
IN assertion: the field freq is set for all tree elements.
OUT assertions: the fields len and code are set to the optimal bit length
and corresponding code. The length opt_len is updated; static_len is
also updated if stree is not null. The field max_code is set.

member.name: M:System.util.zlib.Tree.d_code(System.Int32)
member.summary: Mapping from a distance to a distance code. dist is the distance - 1 and
must not have side effects. _dist_code[256] and _dist_code[257] are never
used.

member.name: M:System.util.zlib.Tree.gen_bitlen(System.util.zlib.Deflate)
member.summary: Compute the optimal bit lengths for a tree and update the total bit length
for the current block.
IN assertion: the fields freq and dad are set, heap[heap_max] and
above are the tree nodes sorted by increasing frequency.
OUT assertions: the field len is set to the optimal bit length, the
array bl_count contains the frequencies for each bit length.
The length opt_len is updated; static_len is also updated if stree is
not null.

member.name: M:System.util.zlib.Tree.gen_codes(System.Int16[],System.Int32,System.Int16[])
member.summary: Generate the codes for a given tree and bit counts (which need not be
optimal).
IN assertion: the array bl_count contains the bit length statistics for
the given tree and the field len is set for all tree elements.
OUT assertion: the field code is set for all tree elements of non
zero code length.

(See also flush_pending()).

member.name: T:System.IO.StreamHelpers
member.summary: Provides methods to help in the implementation of Stream-derived types.

member.name: M:System.IO.StreamHelpers.ValidateCopyToArgs(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
